abstract: Events this summer at Hershey packing plant in Palmyra, Pa, reveal major holes in State Department's oversight of its summer work and travel program; they also expose serious lapses by Council for Educational Travel, USA, one of more than 70 sponsors contracted by the department to organize the students' trips to the United States and find jobs and housing for them.
snippet: A group of exchange students sponsored by the State Department spent thousands of dollars to experience life in the United States, but what they got were arduous shifts in a factory and no help when they complained.
lead_paragraph: A group of exchange students sponsored by the State Department spent thousands of dollars to experience life in the United States, but what they got were arduous shifts in a factory and no help when they complained.

headline.main: Pleas Unheeded as Students’ U.S. Jobs Soured
headline.print_headline: Pleas Unheeded as Students’ U.S. Jobs Soured
headline.seo: Hershey Exchange Student Warnings Were Ignored
